comments:
Hi,

I'm using Eclipse 3.0.1 + CDT 2.1 on Linux 2.6/AMD64 (64-bit kernel and
userland) with the IBM 1.4.2 SDK.

Loading a workspace with CDT brings up the following exception to the console:

I guess I forgot to include this:

java.library.path=/usr/lib/j2sdk1.4-ibm/jre/bin:/usr/lib/j2sdk1.4-ibm/jre/bin:/usr/lib/j2sdk1.4-ibm/jre/bin/j9vm:/usr/lib/j2sdk1.4-ibm/jre/bin:/usr/lib

The command-line I use to start Eclipse is:

eclipse.commands=-os
linux
-ws
gtk
-arch
amd64
-showsplash
/opt/eclipse/eclipse -showsplash 600
-exitdata
/opt/eclipse/eclipse -exitdata 4ef0800d
-debug
file:/home/jkohen/.eclipse.options
-vm
/usr/lib/j2sdk1.4-ibm/jre/bin/javaw

Although I haven't tested this. It should work now staring with CDT 3.0 M6. We
now have an x86_64 port.
